_header: O blessed Jesu that art full of might
Subjects: saints’ lives; Anne, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Anne — ninety-four stanzas rhyme royal, including 14-stanza prologue

CamTCC601.First Lines:
o blessyd Ihesu that art full of myghtThe ground of vertu and of
                    all goodnes…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Of hys gret mercy that we may be hysAnd when we dy to haue
                    eternall blys
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: Lydgate (ff. 221, 230, both added by later hand)
CamTCC601.Editions:
Parker,  Roscoe E.,
                        ed.  
             The Middle English Stanzaic Versions of the Life of St. Anne.
EETS
         o.s. 174 (1928); repr. 1987: 90-109.

Chetham8009.First Lines:
O blessed Ihesu that arte full of myghtThe wonder of vertu and of
                    all goodnes…
Chetham8009.Last Lines:
…Of hys gret mercy that we may be hysAnd when we dye to haue
                    eternall blise
Chetham8009.Attributed Title: Here endyth the lyff of Seynt Anne (f. 29v)
